verses.roman:
catur-yuga-sahasraṁ tu
brahmaṇo dinam ucyate
sa kalpo yatra manavaś
caturdaśa viśām-pate

synonyms: catuḥ-yuga—four ages; sahasram—one thousand; tu—indeed; brahmaṇaḥ—of Lord Brahmā; dinam—the day; ucyate—is said; saḥ—that; kalpaḥ—a kalpa; yatra—in which; manavaḥ—original progenitors of mankind; caturdaśa—fourteen; viśām-pate—O King.
translation: One thousand cycles of four ages constitute a single day of Brahmā, known as a kalpa. In that period, O King, fourteen Manus come and go.
